changes.text: Your vehicle's powertrain software has been updated to help prevent a possible error state where unnecessary messages may appear. • Your vehicle is now enhanced with improved stability during low-state-of-charge battery conditions, and you will get more reliable warnings in the driver display when low-state-of-charge conditions exist. • Your Anti-lock Braking System calibration has been optimized to help improve your vehicle’s performance.

Advanced Driver Assistance System*Driver Monitoring System* • Your driver monitoring system has been upgraded, reducing false eyes-off warnings when you're using the hands-free feature for a more enjoyable drive
Ford Bluecruise Map Update. If your vehicle is equipped with BC: We've made updates to your BC maps expiration date to help keep things running smoothly.
A minor change so your vehicle can easily install the more intricate updates coming in the future. (PowerBoost Only?)
Refinements have been made to help improve connectivity.

2021-2023 23-PU1009-SS-NS Jan 2024 Group ID 1 - Software Update: Your vehicle has been updated with following: Powertrain Your vehicle's powertrain software has been updated to help prevent a possible error state where a “Stop Safely Now” message may appear. Stability Improvements Your vehicle is now enhanced with improved stability during low-state-of-charge battery conditions, and you will get more reliable warnings in the driver display when low-state-of-charge conditions exist. We have made update to your ABS calibration to optimize your vehicle performance. Approach Detection: Approach detection functionality has been added to your vehicle which recognizes when you are approaching to the vehicle with a valid key fob and will provide the welcome animation. You can enable or disable the approach detection on the Sync screen. Priority Update 23-PU1009-SS-NS ABS, PCM, BECM & SOBDMC NO 15-20
We’ve just completed a quality improvement to your trailer position/license plate lights. There is nothing you need to do.
This update adds robustness to the Driver State Monitoring system and increases availability of BlueCruise and reduces false eyes-off warnings (only for vehicle with driver facing cameras)
We've made background improvements to improve your vehicle's software to enhance your overall experience.
We've made background improvements to improve your vehicle's center display software to enhance your overall experience.
For vehicles equipped with BlueCruise this adds support for lane change assist in the cluster.
Driver facing camera improvements.  Adds robustness to the Driver State Monitoring system and increases availibility of BlueCruise and reduces false eyes-off warnings.
2023 Models: Several modifications have been made to improve the quality of your instrument panel and other features. There is nothing you need to do.

2022 Models: We've made an enhancement to let you know that if your frunk is ever ajar, you will now hear a louder chime. This was done to help ensure that you'll know to take action if ever necessary.

We've made a Software Update that allows you to open your frunk remotely using the FordPass App. That's right. Now you can control your frunk from the palm of your hand. Plus, you'll also receive a Frunk Ajar warning if you try to drive away without your Frunk being fully closed.
We know how important DC Fast Charging is to you, so we've tweaked the charging module to improve reliability and performance.
We've made background improvements to your vehicle's software to enhance your overall experience.
A small adjustment so your vehicle can prepare for future updates.
Refinements have been made to help improve connectivity.

Ford Power-Up delivers the latest software updates to your vehicle. While many updates happen seamlessly in the background as you're driving, some updates look to your preferred schedule to install the latest while you're not using your vehicle (like overnight). Go to Settings, then Software Updates to set your schedule.

To make sure that these non-driveable updates install correctly please ensure that your vehicle is in park, ignition is off, the lights are off, doors, windows, trunk and frunk are closed, and the brake pedal is not being pressed.

New, Clean Design If your vehicle has an 8" or 12" SYNC® screen, you may notice that it looks a little different today. That's because we just unveiled a new design that will help you find your favorite menu settings.
Selectable Drive Modes We've made some changes to the messaging for different drive modes. You should not see a fault message if a drive mode times out.

Improvement to conditions not met alerts With this update, you'll now receive new pop-up alerts to inform you when a condition is not being met so that you can take the required action to receive your vehicle software update. For a non-drivable update, conditions may include that your vehicle is parked, it's not running, all the lights are off, doors and trunk are closed, and you're not pressing the brake pedal.
Ford BlueCruise Map Update If your vehicle is equipped with Ford BlueCruise.

Easy on the eyes. You may have noticed that things look a little different on your vehicle screen today. That's because we're continuing to improve the modern design to make it simple to navigate and find what you're looking for. A few changes you'll notice include a smaller top bar, and we've moved some icons to make it easier to view. A dedicated user profile button has even been added. Smart Changes to Phone As A Key Setting up Phone As A Key just got easier. That's because you can now edit and save your Phone As A Key settings from the driver profile screen in-vehicle. To manage your Phone As A Key settings in your driver profile, go to Personal Profile > Edit > Phone in your vehicle's SYNC® screen. You may also set up automatic sign-in so that your driver profile is ready as soon as you enter the vehicle. Step up to the mic All Ford F-150 Lightning customers are now able to share instant feedback with Ford, by recording and sending voice feedback from the convenience of your vehicle. Available in the U.S. only and requires FordPass® Connect modem activation. We will use this feedback to help make quality and design improvements. If you have a safety or service-related concern, please contact your dealer or the Customer Relationship Center. To get started, simply go to the Features tab or App screen in-vehicle and tap on Record Feedback. We look forward to hearing from you. Details matter This update helps make it easy for you to review your charging session summary, including the state of charge, cost, distance added, charge time and even the balance on your subscription (if applicable).
Selectable Drive Modes We've made some changes to the messaging for different drive modes. You should not see a fault message if a drive mode times out.

Improvement to conditions not met alerts With this update, you'll now receive new pop-up alerts to inform you when a condition is not being met so that you can take the required action to receive your vehicle software update. For a non-drivable update, conditions may include that your vehicle is parked, it's not running, all the lights are off, doors and trunk are closed, and you're not pressing the brake pedal.
Ford BlueCruise Map Update If your vehicle is equipped with Ford BlueCruise.

Intelligent Range Update... For more accurate range predictions, our newly enhanced Intelligent Range works with your Ford Navigation System by factoring in elements like traffic speed, external temperature and hill grades to the route you have selected. Travel with confidence knowing you have what you need to get where you're going.
Europe: Improvements and fixes.  This update brings optimization of vehicle connectivity (FordPass Connect) as well as adjustments and fixes to the system for better stability.
Small changes here and there. Ongoing updates like this help you enjoy the best possible version of your F-150® truck. Enjoy.
If you recently received the 6.2.0 update, we've just released version 6.2.1 with even more enhancements to improve your driving experience.

Easy on the eyes. You may have noticed that things look a little different on your vehicle screen today. That's because we're continuing to improve the modern design to make it simple to navigate and find what you're looking for. A few changes you'll notice include a smaller top bar and we've moved some icons to make it easier to view. A dedicated user profile button has even been added.

EStep up to the mic, please! For this latest Ford Power-Up software update, we listened to your feedback and made it easier for you to continue to share your experiences by recording and sending voice feedback from the convenience of your vehicle. Prior to this update, access for this feature was in the Settings-General menu. But now it's been moved to the App screen and will be available whenever your vehicle is activated in FordPass. Look for the new Record Feedback microphone icon — and continue to let us know what you really think

No need to sound the alarm! This update will allow you to easily turn the motion sensor alarm OFF from the vehicle settings screen or alert POPUP. That means when you have a passenger or pet inside, they can move around while you do the same outside.
Ford Bluecruise Map Update: If your vehicle is equipped with BC, we've made an update to your BC maps expiration.

Intelligent Backup Power: We've made an update to help ensure a smooth experience when using your vehicle for power. If your connection is disrupted, the system will search for another before timing out.

Intelligent Backup Power: We've made an update to help ensure a smooth experience when using your vehicle for power. If your connection is disrupted, the system will search for another before timing out.
Small changes here and there. Ongoing updates like this help you enjoy the best possible version of your F-150® truck. Enjoy.
This update addresses the issue where radio presets have been affected during vehicle software updates.
We updated your PCM to fix a potential no-start condition.

If you recently received the 6.2.0 update, we've just re-released the same version with a few enhancements to improve your driving experience. Display Updates You may have noticed that things look a little different on your vehicle screen today. That's because we're continuing to improve the modern design to make it simple to navigate and find what you're looking for. A few changes you'll notice include a smaller top bar and we've moved some icons to make it easier to view. A dedicated user profile button has even been added. Record Feedback For this latest Ford Power-Up software update, we listened to your feedback and made it easier for you to continue to share your experiences by recording and sending voice feedback from the convenience of your vehicle. Prior to this update, access for this feature was in the Settings-General menu. But now it's been moved to the App screen and will be available whenever your vehicle is activated in FordPass
A small adjustment so your vehicle can prepare for future updates.
This update helps allow passengers in the back seat to mirror their device onto the Rear Seat Entertainment screen using the available Wifi hotspot service within your vehicle.

If your Expedition® SUV is equipped with 15.5″ portrait screen, you’ll receive the following updates: Easy on the eyes You may have noticed that things look a little different on your vehicle screen today. That’s because we’re continuing to improve the modern design to make it simple to navigate and find what you’re looking for. A few changes you’ll notice include a smaller top bar and we’ve moved some icons to make it easier to view. A dedicated user profile button has even been added. Step up to the mic, please For this latest Ford Power-Up software update, we listened to your feedback and made it easier for you to continue to share your experiences by recording and sending voice feedback from the convenience of your vehicle. Prior to this update, access for this feature was in the Settings-General menu. But now it’s been moved to the App screen and will be available whenever your vehicle is activated in FordPass®. Look for the new Record Feedback microphone icon — and continue to let us know what you really think.

The functionality of your Rear View Camera has been improved. We've added a Picture-in-Picture (PiP) capability to the Trailer Reverse Guidance feature, so you can simultaneously monitor two camera views. This split view allows you to view Trailer Reverse Guidance cameras and your choice of either the Center High-Mounted Stop Lamp camera view or the trailer auxiliary camera (bought and installed separately) at the same time to ensure the best visibility while backing your trailer into the tightest of spots.
Update to digital owner's manual.

We made sure that what you need to know is in there and easy to find. Go see it on Ford.com/support or in the FordPass® App. You can also access it in your vehicle through the SYNC®4 touchscreen under the Features tab or through the SYNC® 4A touchscreen under Apps.
Some minor fine-tuning to keep everything running smoothly. Restores driver assist functionality on specific VINs that may have a configuration mismatch with the server.

Updates are bringing the heat. We've made some enhancements to help while you're out on a road trip.  First, if you're heading toward a DC fast charging station (using your vehicle's navigation), your battery will now start to warm up within 20 miles of your destination. This allows the battery to accept a charge at a faster rate in cold weather when you have excess heater capacity, getting you back on the road. Remember, you must enter your fast charging station into the Navigation System in order for preheating to work.  We've also made a quality improvement to the power steering control. There is nothing you need to do.
A few modifictions were made to help improve the illuminated malfunction indicator lamps.
A few adjustments have been made to imporve yout Pro Power Onboard, allowing for an alert that let's you know to close the outlet cover to avoid interference with shifting.
Static-free inbound. If your vehicle is equipped with a B&O system, your vehicle has been updated to remove unexpected static.
Smart Changes. Just a quick note to let you know some refinements have been made. These will make your vehicle better prepared to receive future updates that are more complex.
Improved DC Fast Charging. We know how important DC Fast Charging is to you, so we've tweaked the charging module to improve reliability and performance.

Customer Satisfaction Program 21B36: We fine-tuned your Phone As A Key software to help improve reliability and reduce potential Bluetooth disconnection when unlocking or starting your vehicle. This completes customer satisfaction program 21B36.

An update that's music to your ears. Just a quick note to let you know some refinements have been made to keep things running at their best. This update addresses the issue where radio presets have been affected during vehicle software updates. Talk about something to sing about.
While you may have seen this update before, we're resending to ensure some housekeeping features are included to help further enhance your user experience.
SYNC update to support public WiFi
Apple Carplay 'easy listening improvements'
Video streaming apps for US vehicles: YouTube, NBC News, NBC Today
New games: Bridge Battle and Parking Lot

Ford BlueCruise Delivery, Plus Minor Changes. If your Ford Mustang Mach-E is equipped withthe Ford Co-Pilot360 Active 2.0 Prep Package, your Ford BlueCruise hands-free highway driving feature has now been delivered. This completes what we call Product Improvement Program 21G01. There is nothing you need to do except enjoy the update.  Note: You may have already received some of this functionality in a prior update, but this version has been fine-tuned and includes additional tweaks to other features.
Minor updates here and there. Some minor fine-tuning so your vehicle can easily install the more detailed updates coming down the road.

A vehicle with a view. The functionality of your Rear View Camera has been improved. Some camera views are now available while your vehicle is in motion. To monitor your cargo area or trailer, simply press your camera button and use the center high-mounted stop lamp camera (if equipped) or Rear View Camera, or watch the view from a trailer auxiliary camera (bought and installed separately). For more information on these features, visit Ford.com/support or your digital Owner's Manual.

Updates are bringing the heat. We've made some enhancements to help while you're out on a road trip.  First, if you're heading toward a DC fast charging station (using your vehicle's navigation), your battery will now start to warm up within 20 miles of your destination. This allows the battery to accept a charge at a faster rate in cold weather when you have excess heater capacity, getting you back on the road. Remember, you must enter your fast charging station into the Navigation System in order for preheating to work.  We've also made a quality improvement to the power steering control. There is nothing you need to do.
We've recently completed an improvement to the trailer and tailgate settings for your Ford F-150® truck.
A minor change so your vehicle can easily install the more intricate updates coming in the future.
Displayed range has been adjusted to reflect what is possible with optimal driving practices.

We upgraded software on your vehicle to protect high-voltage battery components from excessive heat generated during DC fast charging and repeated full throttle events. This completes safety recall 22S41.

For those customers who received a letter about recall 22S29, this update also fixes a software glitch in your vehicle that could potentially cause unintended acceleration, unintended deceleration or unintended vehicle movement. This completes safety recall 22S29.
Enhancements made to your heating system (HVAC) to the heat capability and help your vehicle respond to humidity.  This should reduce fogging under certain conditions
Added In-Vehicle Voice Feedback to share instant feedback with Ford
Improvement/adjustment of previous OTA 4.1.3
Smart changes Here and There
Update allows you to connect to public Wi-Fi hotspot throught SYNC
Reissue | New games: Bridge Battle and Parking Lot
Reissue | Some housekeeping features are included to help further enhance your user experience
Removes erroneous 'Air Dam Fault' pop-up message
Improved accuracy of displayed range after AC charging
Correction a condition where for cabin-preconditioning & heated steering wheel may not be working properly
Improved route based energy predictions to recommended battery cooling based on expected thermal loading.
Charger locking pin robustness improvement (retract while off plug)
Improved 12V battery drain by decreasing the frequency of the vehicle waking up.
Shorter time to engage electronic park break after drivers door is opened.
Displayed motor temperature will now increase more gradually.
Distance to Empty algorithm improvement.
Improvement to calibration of brake fluid viscosity algorithm to prevent false DTC detection at cold weather
Improved brake bleed quality
Addresses recall 22S29 for applicable vehicles, fixing a software glitch that could potentially cause unintended acceleration, deceleration, or vehicle movement.
Improved DC Fast Charging. We know how important DC Fast Charging is to you, so we've tweaked the charging module to improve reliability and performance.

Ford Power-Up We've been busy working to make your experience the best it can be. Distance-to-Empty Improvement We updated the software on your truck to improve the accuracy of distance-to-empty measurement.
Adds camera icon to header bar for 2023MY vehicles
Improvements to Apple Carplay; changes to in-vehicle scheduling for updates.
A small adjustment so your vechicle can prepare for furture updates that are more complex. Sync 23014

Volume knob enables control of cabin temperature, fan speed and heated seats

More enhancements are on the way. We've made some minor updates to keep everything running smoothly, including improvements to FordPass® Connect modem
Improvement/adjustment of previous OTA 4.1.1
This particular update will set you up for all future ones to come. Think of it as the update that opens the door for all the others to enter through
Ability to enter your vehicle using your Key Fob during a non-drivable update

Your vehicle can talk (Note that you may have already received an earlier version of Ford Assistant but this update is an enhancement.) Ever wish you could talk to your truck? Now you can with Ford Assistant. Just say, “OK, Ford” to start the conversation, then ask things like "How does my cruise control work?", or "What does Pro Trailer Backup Assist do?". Your assistant will tell you what you need to know
